clinical_study.brief_title: Optimizing Local Anesthetic Concentration for Continuous Lumbar Plexus Nerve Blocks
clinical_study.official_title: Optimizing Local Anesthetic Concentration for Continuous Lumbar Plexus Nerve Blocks

brief_summary.textblock: This is a research study to determine if the concentration of local anesthetic through a catheter next to the nerves that go to the hip that is undergoing surgery, affects muscle strength and sense of touch experienced after surgery. This study is looking at the varying concentrations of local anesthetic placed through the catheter.

detailed_description.textblock: These results will help define the optimal concentration of local anesthetic used for continuous peripheral nerve blocks and help guide future research in this clinically-relevant area.

primary_outcome.measure: Quadriceps femoris muscle strength, by measuring the maximum voluntary isometric contraction (MVIC). The difference in MVIC on POD1 compared with the preoperative MVIC, expressed as a percentage of the preoperative MVIC.
primary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points: baseline (Immediately prior to surgery) and postoperative day 2 (morning following surgery between 8:30-10:30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hip adductor strength, evaluated in sitting position using the same technique as described for the primary outcome measure.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points: baseline (Immediately prior to surgery) and postoperative day 2 (morning following surgery between 8:30-10:30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hip flexor strength, evaluated in the supine position using the same technique as described for the primary outcome measure.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points: baseline (Immediately prior to surgery) and postoperative day 2 (morning following surgery between 8:30-10:30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensory level, evaluated in the seated position, the current through TES is increased from 0mV until the patient describes mild discomfort and the current is then recorded.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points: baseline (Immediately prior to surgery) and postoperative day 2 (morning following surgery between 8:30-10:30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Ambulatory ability, evaluated using the 100-foot walk test and the six minute walk test. Afer patients walk 100 feet, they will continue to walk for six minutes and the total distance will be recorded.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points: baseline (Immediately prior to surgery) and postoperative day 2 (morning following surgery between 8:30-10:30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Range of motion, evaluated using a standard goniometer for hip flexion within precaution limits.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points: baseline (Immediately prior to surgery) and postoperative day 2 (morning following surgery between 8:30-10:30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight bearing, evaluated using a standard scale to demonstrate the correct amount of weight to place on an operative extremity.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points: baseline (Immediately prior to surgery) and postoperative day 2 (morning following surgery between 8:30-10:30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain, evaluated using a verbal rating scale of 0-10, where 0=no pain and 10=worst imaginable pain.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points: baseline (Immediately prior to surgery) and postoperative day 2 (morning following surgery between 8:30-10:30)
secondary_outcome.description: Average of all pain scores (other than during physical therapy)

arm_group.description: Patients will be given 0.1% ropivicaine provided via infusion pump which will be attached intraoperatively and will remain connected until patient is ready to leave the hospital. In this time a physical therapist will work with the patient to assess outcome measures.

Patients will be given 0.4% ropivicaine provided via infusion pump which will be attached intraoperatively and will remain connected until patient is ready to leave the hospital. In this time a physical therapist will work with the patient to assess outcome measures.

intervention.description: Patients will be randomized to one of two groups: ropivicaine 0.1% infusion or ropivicaine 0.4% infusion. The infusion rate will be set at 12mL/hour and 3mL/hour respectively and the outcome measures will be assessed by physical therapy using the described methods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary, unilateral hip arthroplasty
- age greater than or equal to 18 years
- postoperative analgesic plan includes perineural local anesthetic infusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- morbid obesity as defined by a body mass index greater than 40
- chronic high dose opioid use
- history of opioid abuse
- neuro-muscular deficit of the ipsilateral femoral nerve and/or quadriceps muscle
- vulnerable populations i.e., children, pregnant women, or prisoners
